headline: Chef John's Shrimp and Grits
description: Enjoy this classic and simple shrimp and grits dish for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

video.description: See how to make some classic Southern comfort food.
video.name: How to Make Shrimp and Grits

name: Chef John's Shrimp and Grits

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until almost crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat and transfer bacon to a dish, leaving drippings in the skillet.
Whisk 1/4 cup water, cream, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce together in a bowl.

Stir 4 cups water, butter, and 1 teaspoon salt together in a pot; bring to a boil. Whisk grits into pot, bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and cook until grits are creamy, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from heat and stir white Cheddar cheese into grits.
Place shrimp in a large bowl and season with Cajun seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and a pinch of cayenne pepper.

Heat skillet with bacon drippings over high heat. Cook shrimp in hot bacon fat in a single layer for 1 minute. Turn shrimp and add jalapeno; cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir cream mixture, bacon, green onion, and garlic to shrimp mixture; cook and stir, adding water as necessary to thin the sauce, until shrimp are cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley.
Ladle grits into a bowl and top with shrimp and sauce.

review.reviewBody: It is very good! I doubled the sauce because... yum! I used cilantro instead of parsley. You must try this recipe! I love Chef John's recipes, and this is no exception.
This is a great recipe .
LOVE IT!
The right amount of spicy and creamy and cheesy. The first time I made it I got the "look". Now I get, "we need to have this more. " I usually double the cream sauce because I do love it so.
This recipe was super easy and super quick. I wouldn't change a thing! It was spicey and creamy and just delicious. We loved it.
Delish as written!
I didn't have white cheddar on hand; I used smoked gouda. I got a happy smile from everyone! I'll definitely make this again!
This is a recipe where I’m confused why more people haven’t saved it. It’s
We made this tonight and it was AMAZING!!!!!! Love chef John!
Thanks for the recipe Chef John. I followed your recipe except that I added a few TB of diced onions and used half and half. I was out of cream. Your videos are always helpful and interesting.
Excellent recipe. Everyone loves it!
This was awesome! I made it more Mexican with green chilies & picante. I can’t eat salt so I skipped the bacon. I highly recommend!
Wonderful recipe
Yummo! Doubled the sauce and thickened with a bit of flour and left out the jalapeño. Used Tony Chachere creole seasoning. Very good recipe

Awesome! I have made several of Chef John's recipe's. I feel this is one of his best that he's placed on this site. Seem's that all the ingredients were spot on. Very full of flavor to the pallet. Thanks so much for sharing.
loved it and simple to make
Followed recipe, except doubled everything. Little tricky to get all the shrimp in the pan in one layer. Flavor was amazing. Will make again, and again. Thank you, Chef John!
wife loved it

This was great. I made it exactly as written. Next time I would increase the amount of shrimp, at least double(maybe triple) the amount of cajun seasoning and 4x the sauce. There is only about 1/8 cup of sauce after it coats the shrimp. we wanted more to eat with our grits. Will definitely make again with the adjustments
So good!
I love all these flavors, but something was missing. The bacon totally took over the flavor of the shrimp, and the grits needed much more cheese and butter. Just kind of meh.

I usually make a Creole style shrimp and grits, with tomatoes. But I loved this version so much more than mine, so I’ll be making it this way for now on! My husband and two boys loved it as well, even the picky one. I followed the recipe pretty closely, with only a couple small changes for lack of the ingredient. Excellent recipe, thank you Chef John!
This was so delicious! I didn’t have a fresh lemon on hand so I used fresh squeezed orange juice and a few drops of vinegar.

Nice flavor. I didn’t have jalapeño so it didn’t have the punch. Made my own Cajun seasoning and think i could have increased the amount. Loved the grits as always. Definitely need to prep all ingredients and it cooks up in a snap!!!
It was very good. I used thick bacon. It left too much grease. Next time I will use leaner bacon. It still was very good.

Hard to describe how delicious this is! I’ve become a huge fan of Chef John’s and trust that his recipes will be 5 star! My son went to college in Asheville where cooking grits is an art— this recipe matches the best we’ve had!
Excellent!!! This was absolutely delicious! Did not change a thing!

Excellent recipe! I used chicken broth and heavy cream for my grits and sautéed the onions and garlic. I also doubled the recipe for the sauce because we like to have more. This was absolutely delicious.
I make small changes every time i make this but this recipe is a great starting point.
This was one of the best things I have ever eaten! Next time I will put in less jalapeno. It was just a little too hot for my taste. Great recipe!
Follow directions and recipe and you will LOVE this...best ever !
This looks good. Wanna to try to make this, not sure I can use polenta to replace grits. As I can’t find this ingredient at my place.
I love shrimp and grits. Whenever I am at a restaurant and it's on the menu I will try. This recipe is by far the best. I double steps 1, 2, and 5 because I like more sauce.
What a fabulous recipe and not to hot for my mom. I skipped the heavy cream for extra butter since I knew buying it would mean most would go to waste. Definitely will make this again!
Very appetizing.

Everything that chef John makes always comes out 100%. And this shrimp and grits is no exception. I’ve made it several times, I’m going to switch out the cheddar cheese for smoked Gouda. The reason is because I went to a really nice restaurant and that was a side dish and it was to die for.?. I love any kind of grits or polenta but this smoked Gouda grits was exceptional?.

This is a great recipe. I had to make do with instant grits, but next time I’ll use the real deal. I’m not a huge fan of jalapeño so I simply doubled the Cajun seasoning and still got the right amount of heat and flavor. To tell you the truth, the bacon made this dish, so don’t skimp and use a good quality bacon. I like my grits cheesy, so I’ll probably double the amount time. The sauce/gravy looks like it will be watery at first, but relax. It will thicken nicely and be a delicious sauce for this brunch or supper dish!
This is my go-to shrimp and grits recipe. I’ve made it time and time again and never change a thing. Why mess with perfection? Another great recipe from Chef John!
Mine turned out amazing! I garnished with the green onions and seasoned my grits while cooking. A++
Easy and delicious. This is now one of mine and my husbands favorite dishes.

This was delicious. I used a Poblano pepper because that is what I had. I did not cook bacon from scratch; I used the prepared bacon, just sliced it thinly. I cooked the shrimp with avocado oil then added the pepper and other ingredients. I think everything else was as directed. We loved this dish. It seemed intimidating at first but I just prepared the ingredients before I began cooking. We will definitely make this again.
I stuck to the recipe, and it came out great! I'll be making this dish again in the near future.
This went fast. The family ate it all! Very good. We didn’t change a thing.
Love it!
Made it as written and it was so good and decadent. I also added some andouille bc my husband is not a big fan of shrimp. I didn’t have a fresh jalapeño so I used canned. Perfection.

It turned out fabulously. I will be making this one again. The only changes I made were sautéing half a red onion and two jalapeños in the beginning and adding them to the grits along with the cheese, which I went a little heavy on. For spices I made the Creole Spice Blend recipe and used a couple of tablespoons of that on the shrimp. I think it was true to the basic recipe and added some touches that we appreciate at our place.
I made this last night and it was delicious! It was very easy to make and the grits were so creamy! I will definitely be keeping this in my repertoire
Still need to perfect the seafood gravy. Fun times. Tasty meal.
Wouldn’t change a thing, this was delicious!

This was delicious! The only change we made was to double the sauce...we love a good sauce. I added a cornstarch slurry to thicken it up a bit and the consistency and taste were amazing. Next time I’ll use fresh shrimp. Mine was frozen so the only off taste was shrimp quality. This was my first attempt at shrimp and grits. So easy to follow, thank you! This is a keeper.
A tad bit labor intensive, but well worth the effort! I will make this again, for sure!

This was my first time eating shrimp and grits. I would have enjoyed it more with less salt. I would cut the salt in the grits and the salt on the shrimp in half. I love most of Chef John’s recipes though!

My girlfriend cannot eat red meat or byproducts of red meat. To substitute the depth of flavor from the bacon I chose to smoke the shrimp. Otherwise, I left this MARVELOUS recipe unchanged. She and I both agree INSTANT FAVORITE! Side note: It was her first time to eat grits that she enjoyed. Kudos from Texas!
Daughter wanted shrimp and grits for her Birthday Dinner, Chef John's was a perfect choice! Delicious, didn't have to change a thing!!

Decided to bring New Orleans to us with all this craziness, and this recipe did not disappoint! Liked how simple the recipe was, so gave it a try. Subbed in some red chili powder on the shrimp and Tony Chachere’s creole seasoning. Only had sliced pepper jack l, so sliced it into squares and tossed in. Gives the grits a kick now and then. Next time will add a bit more heavy cream and an ounce or two of white wine.
Will make again. The only change I made was to double the recipe. It was a hit.

We followed the recipe exactly except we used cilantro instead of parsley because that is what we had. My husband and I made it for our anniversary dinner. It was better than anything we could have eaten in a restaurant. Definitely making this again!
Tasted amazing! Husband does not like grits but I loved this recipe.
Perfect comfort food.
Delicious! I added some sautéed smoked sausage. Cooked the grits in chicken broth. Will double or triple the sauce next time. It was perfect! Tasted better that what I have gotten at restaurants

Really delicious! Will save a little of the cooked bacon for a BLT next time, but bacon lovers will like that element. I was concerned about the blandness of the cheese grits, but after putting the sauce on top that was made with the shrimp, it makes perfect sense. Good call by the chef. Watch out for flying hot grits while stirring when they cook.
Very tasteful and quite elegant, at least for people in the west

I will definitely make this again. I used chicken broth in grits instead of water. I also used Parmesan instead of cheddar for the grits. It makes the grits saltier, but I prefer Parmesan over cheddar in my grits. Otherwise, I made the shrimp part exactly as given. Just enough spice . Not overpowering. Absolutely delicious!
Made for the family and they loved it. Daughter said it was the best dish I've ever made.
Very good recipe, but I’d just as soon eat it with just the bacon and no shrimp.
i sliced some cherry tomatoes and put them on top , the whole sat on a bed of slivered lettuce and red onion
My second time making this one. It's as good today as I remembered it being the first time.
I used yellow cornmeal, but food was still excellent. I would like to make this again.

This was the perfect recipe for Shrimp and Grits that I have been looking for. I doubled the recipe for a dinner party and only made small changes. I used 2X the cheese and substituted smoked Gouda. I can’t wait to make it again!
Followed the recipe as written and it turned out awesome. I have tried several Chef John’s recipe and they turn out great. He’s a fantastic chef to follow...
Made it as the recipe called for it, better than I thought, great flavor, will make it again

Wow..turned out perfectly
Used locally sourced S African mieli meel bcos..in Canada reg grocery stores have no idea re "hominy grits"

This is absolutely delicious and very easy to execute. I’ve made it twice and doubled the sauce both times. I think I will triple the sauce next time because it’s just too good. I love the garlic level but it’s a little too much for my husband. Next time I will add the garlic sooner so it cooks out more and might cut the garlic in half (sadly) ;).
awesome
Delicious recipe - this truly does not need any modifications! Just the right amount of heat, too. Definitely a keeper
I’ve never had Shrimp & Grits before so I have nothing to compare it to. I wanted to try something new and found this recipe. WOW - This was so good. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
Big fan of Chef John and this recipe was amazing!!! The flavors were amazing and followed the recommendations to double the sauce amount! Making this again!!
Only thing I changed was the use of milk rather than cream and thin turkey bacon. Other than that it was delicious and the family loved it.
Comfort food! Will make again but next time with a fried egg!
Simple recipe with amazing results! I have not found any shrimp and grits recipe that beats this one!
So easy, quick and good. house guest and family loved it.
Better than any shrimp and grits I've ever had at any restaurant!

I hate to do this but I modified the recipe. Personally I hate when people do that then review but here I go doing the same thing! I left out the cream. Added cheese and okra to the grits. It was beyond amazing. I’m going to make it again but I don’t see what the cream would do for this other than make a richer, fattier sauce. Without the cream the sauce was thin but I guess the cheese and okra in the grits made up for it. When the shrimp and the grits combined the taste was perfect and rich.
Delicious! I eliminated the jalapeños and used chicken broth in the grits instead of water. Delicious!

Delicious - but I think the sauce had too much water. I did double the sauce ingredients, but next time I would NOT double the water. I would have liked it a bit thicker. I also added mushrooms, which I sauteed with the onion and garlic a bit before adding it to the sauce (could that have thinned it too much?). Took veggies out of pan, sauteed shrimp for a minute and then added sauce/veggies back in to finish cooking. Also, remember to make the grits with broth, not water - forgot this time, and definitely not as flavorful. Still good, though!
Fantastic recipe! I've never made grits before and these turned out delicious!
REMOVE THE TAILS FROM THE SHRIMP!
It was good. Something seemed missing to me, but I will try it again. My guest loved it.
We didn’t make any changes and it was delicious. We’ve made it several times and keep coming back to this recipe.
Used fresh gulf shrimp. Had to use pickled jalapeños as couldn’t get fresh but otherwise went by the recipe. It was excellent and not too over the top as far as prep.
First time making shrimp and grits. The family loved it!!
Delicious. Added mushrooms was the only change I made and didn’t add water while cooking to thin out the sauce.

Thank you, Chef John, for yet another award winning recipe !!! The only thing I did differently was put less shrimp in my own bowl due to chewing issues, but no one else complained that they got too much !!

Chef John’s recipes never disappoint. I added some diced tomatoes to mine not because it needed them but just because of a craving I was having. Turned out fantastic! And so easy to make. I did mine with my toddler hanging all over me.
These were amazing! So easy!

This is a good recipe but the grits weren't very creamy. To really get those grits nice and creamy, I added about a 1/4 to 1/3 cup of heavy cream to the water for the grits, brought that to a boil and then simmered them in that for about 20 minutes.
Soooo delicious! I didn’t have shrimp so I made it with chicken breast and it was still so good. I will make this over and over!
Outstanding!
Hubby & I really enjoyed this, best grits ever!! Followed the recipe exactly! Just another amazing recipe Chef John has out there for us! Thanks!!!
